title: I found out something disturbing about Daisy
body:
Yesterday, I was playing Thresh in a ranked game and the enemy jungler was Ivern.

After a failed gank at bot lane, I managed to q Daisy and my adc finished her off since she was low on life.

At this moment, I realized something: unlike Tibbers, Daisy does not drop a soul when killed (and before you ask, she still had like 10 sec to live and I also clearly saw her ''dying'' animation instead of ''see you later, Ivern'' animation).

Does this mean that Daisy doesn't have a soul? It's strange since Blue always drops a soul when he dies. Or perhaps, she gave her soul to Ivern or something?

replies.body: Daisy is actually a god-like entity of pure malice that merely follows the whims of this outrageously excited tree man while planning behind the scenes to find a way to hug the earth and crush it in her massive stone hands.

League Pecking Order:

You, the dirt, the worms inside of the dirt, Dasiy's stool, Ao' Shin, then Dasiy

Any questions?
Uhm, yeah

*Bitch slaps JVP15 off of Mount Targon*

Any other questions?
{{champion:44}}  get off my mountain or ill shove my gem inside you : ^)
Time to plan a road trip to Targon.
You say that like it's a bad thing.

Later...

{{champion:13}} ults while giving an evil grin as all but he and the support {{champion:26}} eagerly get inside.

{{champion:26}} : By the way, where did you send them?

{{champion:13}} : I can tell you where they're not. _SAFE!_
Then Gromp.
and scuttle at the top. scuttle is the one true god.
I believe you mean the river duck.
Blasphemy, the only true god of the river is scuttle.

***AHEM***
{{champion:98}}
Shen is the champion of the great scuttle.
Sejuani and Bristle only drop a single soul (Although Nunu and Willump drop two), I wouldn't look too far into it. Probably just a gameplay oversight as opposed to a story conspiracy.
It's because Sejuani is ginger! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rrzb75qN,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-12T20:05:34.678+0000)
>
> It's because Sejuani is ginger! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

:P

I wonder, do Kindred drop two souls?

Nope, since they are a one being instead of 2.

I knew about Sej and her mount but I thought it was because of the joke that Midnight posted.

If Blue would never drop a soul, that would be ''normal'' for sentinels but since he does...

>I knew about Sej and her mount but I thought it was because of the joke that Midnight posted 

The opposite, actually. Nunu dropping 2 souls is an Easter egg. Similar to how skins with sunglasses take 1 less damage from Leona passive.

I think that was removed?
Also, I think it was from Leona ult, to make the impact almost unnoticeable.
It was definately her passive "Sunlight" that had damage reduced by sunglasses.
but sejuani has light blonde hair she isn't ginger

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rrzb75qN,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-12T20:05:34.678+0000)
>
> It's because Sejuani is ginger! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

But poro rider sej only drops one soul but she is blonde... Don't Kat and mf drop souls?
It's a joke, because there are some weird people out there who say that ginger people don't have souls. The joke has been around for a long time with sej.

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rrzb75qN,comment-id=0000000000020000,timestamp=2016-12-13T21:18:31.222+0000)
>
> It's a joke, because there are some weird people out there who say that ginger people don't have souls. The joke has been around for a long time with sej.

I know its a joke that has been around for a while. The question is if skaarl would drop a soul if he were able to die. o.o
He'd drop a half of soul that wanders around aimlessly
Was it candy king ivern? cause if it was he probably already took Daisys soul.
Am I missing a back-story here?

> [{quoted}](name=RookPusher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rrzb75qN,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-12-12T21:43:48.192+0000)
>
> Am I missing a back-story here?

Have you seen him!?  He definitely has stolen some souls.
Yup, I hate this skin, so spooky.
so what youre saying is, daisy is a ginger
http://www.albinoblacksheep.com/video/saladfingers/saladfingers1.png

And I thought I had escaped this rusty spoon lover forever...

Thank you for re-conjuring old nightmares...
{{champion:427}}  pssst, sometimes I like to rub nettles on my wooden teets!

Always been an interesting conundrum, do synthetic sentient beings have souls? Annie's tibbers is supposedly an enslaved demon, but not much is known about Ivern's daisy. I'd guess daisy is a golem or other kind of mindless/slave construct.
Ivern's lore says that he came across Daisy, a stone golem who was injured and near death. He healed her and they became lifelong friends. So not a mindless synthetic slave

Minions are mindless magical constructs similar to illusions made in bulk by the Institute of war.
Yet they drop souls. . .

If that's that case (haven't read any of the recently changed lore), then why don't they (those in the institute) throw paper airplanes at eachother; instead of wasting the time and resources to fabricate dozens of these little guys to kamikaze?

>(haven't read any of the recently changed lore) 

Neither have I. This is old lore. Thresh was made back when the IoW was a thing.

>throw paper airplanes at eachother 

Summoner battles were a spectator sport. (>_>)

> Thresh was made back when the IoW was a thing.

Just to jump in, not true at all. If you look at his old lore, theres not even a hint of a mention of the League. The IoW was being phased out from the lore from roughly around Zyra's release. No champion since that time was made with the League's old universe in mind.
Whata does IoW stand for

Institute of War.
It's where the summoners resided when sending champions to battle to the death.

I remember now. I just couldn't figure what the abbreviation was. I remember they had some like, weekly Newspaper that had stories about the diplomatic and political circumstances between each o the states, and it made it feel like Runeterra was an actual place and that we could potentially be natives in this fantasy world. Then Riot said fuck our imagination.

I miss the League "Verdicts" on Champions, those were great. Like Leona's

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Leona/History

"phasing", not "Phased".

And the minion design is based on the old Journal of Justice articles (now also phased out). I don't know if the new lore has addressed them yet.
Or SR in general.
Blitz drops a soul

My question is posed towards different possibilities, also so does orianna. Both of who are magically animated mechanical beings capable of speech, daisy appears to be animated stone that cannot talk; is speech, or the material the character is made of, the deciding factor to having a soul? 
Or is it something else? That's what I'm trying to get at with my question.
Does heimer turret drop souls? Shaco boxes?
Those are tools, objects, devices, and machines.
Yes but are they coded as minions
And they don't drop souls. Can you imagine if ZZ Rot portal bugs did
